availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Watkins (Lyon County, Kentucky, private school teacher)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, private school teacher. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas G. Watkins and Nancy B. Watkins. Married to S. C. Watkins. Father of W. W. Watkins and H. M. Watkins. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Private school teacher in Lyon County ni 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 382A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 728.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 42A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, X County Wills, 1847-1941, p. 217.
"Judge Thomas Jefferson Watkins (1838-1908)," Find A Grave, Memorial #6656639, accessed November 19, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6656639.
